School districts are preparing for students to return early next weekend home county and Franklin County which sits along Florida's northern coast the classes are still cancelled in most parts of Florida's panhandle ravaged by hurricane Michael

Oregon court of appeals is set to hear a case of an African American man convicted by a non unanimous jury as Oregon Public Broadcasting's Conrad Wilson reports if the court granted a new trial effectively means Oregon would have to abandon its split jury system because it's unconstitutional
Twenty Fifteen Olin Williams was convicted of first degree sodomy by a split jury meaning there were two jurors who thought Williams was not guilty now he's asking the court of appeals for a new trial like Williams one of those dissenting jurors was African American Williams attorney says ...
Now I got into court of appeals for a new trial like William one of those dissenting jurors was African American Williams attorney says Oregon non unanimous jury system violates the equal protection clause of the U.S constitution
The Oregon department of justice argues Williams requests for a new trial should be denied because it's not based on new discovered evidence or and allegations of German misconduct
Oregon and Louisiana are the only state that allow non you'd end up of juries and criminal cases for NPR News I'm Wilson in Portland
